ppe_requirements.respiratory: Organic vapor respirator with appropriate cartridge for known VOC concentrations. SCBA for unknown mixtures or high concentrations.
ppe_requirements.skin: Nitrile or butyl rubber gloves depending on specific VOC. Chemical-resistant clothing for liquid contact.
ppe_requirements.eye: Chemical safety goggles, face shield for splash hazard.
ppe_requirements.minimum_level: Level C for known low concentrations, Level B for unknown mixtures or high vapor concentrations
ppe_requirements.special_notes: VOCs vary widely in toxicity. Mixture effects unpredictable. Some VOCs carcinogenic (benzene, formaldehyde). Others neurotoxic (toluene, xylene). Identify specific VOCs when possible.

physical_properties.appearance: Colorless to colored liquids or gases
physical_properties.odor: Variable - sweet, pungent, solvent-like, or odorless

emergency_response.fire_hazard: Many VOCs flammable or combustible. Vapors heavier than air. May travel to ignition sources. Explosive mixtures possible.
emergency_response.fire_suppression: Use dry chemical, CO2, foam appropriate for specific VOC. Water spray to cool containers. Prevent runoff contamination.
emergency_response.spill_procedures: Eliminate ignition sources. Ventilate area. Identify VOCs if possible. Contain with absorbent. Dispose as hazardous waste. Monitor air quality.
emergency_response.exposure_immediate_actions: Remove to fresh air. Eyes: flush with water. Remove contaminated clothing. Wash skin. Seek medical attention - inform physician of specific VOCs if known. Monitor for delayed effects.
emergency_response.environmental_hazards: Many VOCs toxic to aquatic life. Contribute to ozone formation and smog. Bioaccumulate. Contaminate groundwater.
emergency_response.special_hazards: Complex mixtures with unpredictable effects. Some carcinogenic (benzene, formaldehyde, 1,3-butadiene). Others neurotoxic (toluene, xylene, styrene). Respiratory irritants. Contribute to indoor air quality problems. Chronic exposure health effects vary widely.

storage_requirements.temperature_range: Cool storage below 25°C typical. Refrigerate if highly volatile.
storage_requirements.ventilation: Local exhaust ventilation. Outdoor storage preferred for large quantities.
incompatibilities: Variable - check specific VOC SDS. Generally: oxidizers, strong acids, strong bases
storage_requirements.container_material: Depends on specific VOC. Metal or glass typically. Check compatibility.
storage_requirements.segregation: Separate from oxidizers. Flammable storage if applicable.
storage_requirements.quantity_limits: Follow NFPA 30 for flammable/combustible liquids. Minimize quantities.
storage_requirements.special_requirements: Label with specific VOC contents. Post appropriate hazard signs. Secondary containment for liquids. Gas detection for enclosed spaces. Emergency procedures.

epa_hazard_categories: Variable - may include carcinogenicity, neurotoxicity, reproductive toxicity, aquatic toxicity

osha_pel.twa_8hr: Variable by specific VOC. No general limit.

acgih_tlv.twa_8hr: Variable by specific VOC. TLVs exist for individual compounds.

reactivity.stability: Variable. Many stable under normal conditions. Some polymerize or degrade.
reactivity.polymerization: Some VOCs polymerize (styrene, acrylates). Check individual compounds.
incompatible_materials: Variable - commonly: oxidizers, strong acids, strong bases, reactive metals
hazardous_decomposition: Variable toxic gases depending on compound
reactivity.reactivity_hazard: Variable. Many form explosive mixtures with air. Some react violently with oxidizers. Peroxide formation possible in ethers.

environmental_impact.aquatic_toxicity: Variable. Many VOCs toxic to aquatic life (LC50: 1-1000 mg/L range).
environmental_impact.biodegradability: Variable. Some readily biodegradable, others persistent.
environmental_impact.bioaccumulation: Variable. Log Kow range: -1 to 7. Lipophilic VOCs bioaccumulate.
environmental_impact.soil_mobility: Variable. Many volatile from soil. Some adsorb strongly.
environmental_impact.atmospheric_fate: Photochemical reactions. Form ozone and smog. Atmospheric half-life: hours to months. Major air quality concern.
environmental_impact.ozone_depletion: Some VOCs deplete ozone (CFCs, halons - now banned)

reportable_releases.water: Variable by specific VOC (1-5000 lbs typical)
reportable_releases.air: Variable by specific VOC. VOC emissions regulated.

detection_monitoring.detection_range: 0.1-10,000 ppm depending on sensor and VOC

alarm_setpoints.low: Variable - set to specific VOC TLV or mixture assessment
alarm_setpoints.evacuate: Variable - set to IDLH of most hazardous component

colorimetric_tubes: VOC-specific tubes available (benzene, toluene, xylene, etc.)
detection_monitoring.odor_threshold: Variable. Some VOCs odorless (benzene), others pungent at low ppm. Olfactory fatigue common. Do not rely on odor.
